alert.note: Alert for Central Ventura County Valleys; Northern Ventura County Mountains; Santa Susana Mountains; Southeastern Ventura County Valleys; Western Santa Monica Mountains Recreational Area (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued August 20 at 5:02AM PDT until further notice by NWS Oxnard
info.description: * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Ventura County and a portion of Santa Barbara County. * WHEN...From 4 PM PDT this afternoon through Monday morning. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff from expected heavy rain may result in flooding of creeks, roads, urban areas, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Low-water crossings may be flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Tropical system Hilary will move over southern California and bring the potential for heavy rain and thunderstorms. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Avoid travel on Sunday into Monday, especially in the mountains. You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: Central Ventura County Valleys; Northern Ventura County Mountains; Santa Susana Mountains; Southeastern Ventura County Valleys; Western Santa Monica Mountains Recreational Area
